p: Both S. yangii and S. abrotanoides are used as a folk medicinal herb in the areas of natural occurrence. S. yangii is a folk medicinal plant used in Pakistan, Turkmenistan, and Afghanistan [ 21, 22]. The plant has antibacterial activity and is also used as a cooling medicine in the treatment of fever [ 3, 23]. It is known for its flavouring qualities and it is also smoked as a euphoriant and used as a decoction for chronic dysentery [ 21]. In Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan, the aboveground parts are used to heal wounds, and a decoction is used to treat scabies [ 17]. In traditional Tibetan and Chinese medicine, it has been claimed that S. yangii is a powerful analgesic and parasiticide agent [ 9, 24].
